   For example, assume a class has the attribute :python:`color = 'red'`.
   Replace it with :python:`color = Config('color', 'red', allowed_values=['red', 'green', 'blue'])` and call :meth:`ConfigFile.load() <confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.load>` (after the attribute has been created but before it's value is used).
   Then a user can create a config file in the :meth:`expected location() <confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.iter_config_paths>` and can change the attribute with ``set color=green``.
   You don't need to change the usage of the attribute because :class:`~confattr.config.Config` implements the `descriptor protocol <https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#implementing-descriptors>`_.
 - It is easy to add custom commands by subclassing :class:`~confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand`. :ref:`[example] <exp-extend>`

+<em class="property"><span class="pre">classmethod</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">push_key_changer</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">callback</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html#collections.abc.Callable" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">Callable</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">,</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.config.Config.push_key_changer" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p>Modify the key of all settings which will be defined after calling this method.</p>
 <p>Call this before an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">import</span></code> and <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.Config.pop_key_changer" title="confattr.config.Config.pop_key_changer"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pop_key_changer()</span></code></a> after it if you are unhappy with the keys of a third party library.
 If you import that library in different modules make sure you do this at the import which is executed first.</p>
 <dl class="field-list simple">
 <dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
 <dd class="field-odd"><p><span class="target" id="confattr.config.Config.push_key_changer.params.callback"></span><strong>callback</strong><a class="paramlink headerlink reference internal" href="#confattr.config.Config.push_key_changer.params.callback"></a>  A function which takes the key as argument and returns the modified key.</p>
 </dd>
 </dl>
 </dd></dl>

 <dd><p>This method is just to provide a common interface for <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.MultiConfig" title="confattr.config.MultiConfig"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">MultiConfig</span></code></a>.

 <p>In contrast to a <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a> instance it does <em>not</em> make a difference whether an instance of this class is accessed as a type or instance attribute.</p>

 <p>If you know that <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.MultiConfig.set_value.params.config_id" title="confattr.config.MultiConfig.set_value"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">config_id</span></code></a> is valid you can also change the items of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.MultiConfig.values" title="confattr.config.MultiConfig.values"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">values</span></code></a> directly.

 <p>A container for several settings which can have different values for different objects.</p>
 <p>This is essentially a <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.DictConfig" title="confattr.config.DictConfig"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">DictConfig</span></code></a> using <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.MultiConfig" title="confattr.config.MultiConfig"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">MultiConfig</span></code></a> instead of normal <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a>.
 However, in order to return different values depending on the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">config_id</span></code> of the owning instance, it implements the <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#implementing-descriptors">descriptor protocol</a> to return an <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.config.InstanceSpecificDictMultiConfig" title="confattr.config.InstanceSpecificDictMultiConfig"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">InstanceSpecificDictMultiConfig</span></code></a> if it is accessed as an instance attribute.</p>

 <dl class="py method">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.get_app_dirs">
-<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">get_app_dirs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><span class="pre">AppDirs</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.get_app_dirs" title="Permalink to this definition"></a></dt>
+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">get_app_dirs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><span class="pre">AppDirs</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.get_app_dirs" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p>Create or get a cached <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ActiveState/appdirs/blob/master/README.rst#appdirs-for-convenience">AppDirs</a> instance with multipath support enabled.</p>
 <p>When creating a new instance, <a class="reference external" href="https://pypi.org/project/platformdirs/">platformdirs</a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://pypi.org/project/xdgappdirs/">xdgappdirs</a> and <a class="reference external" href="https://pypi.org/project/appdirs/">appdirs</a> are tried, in that order.
 The first one installed is used.
 appdirs, the original of the two forks and the only one of the three with type stubs, is specified in pyproject.toml as a hard dependency so that at least one of the three should always be available.
 I am not very familiar with the differences but if a user finds that appdirs does not work for them they can choose to use an alternative with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pipx</span> <span class="pre">inject</span> <span class="pre">appname</span> <span class="pre">xdgappdirs|platformdirs</span></code>.</p>
 <p>These libraries should respect the environment variables <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">XDG_CONFIG_HOME</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">XDG_CONFIG_DIRS</span></code>.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dd><p>Iterate over all paths which are checked for config files, user specific first.</p>
 <p>Use this method if you want to tell the user where the application is looking for its config file.
 The first existing file yielded by this method is used by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.load" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.load"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">load()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>The paths are generated by joining the directories yielded by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.iter_user_site_config_paths" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.iter_user_site_config_paths"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">iter_user_site_config_paths()</span></code></a> with
 <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.config_name" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.config_name"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.config_name</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>If <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.config_path" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.config_path"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">config_path</span></code></a> has been set this method yields that path instead and no other paths.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 This method compiles the given information into an error message and calls <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.UiNotifier.show_error" title="confattr.configfile.UiNotifier.show_error"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">self.ui_notifier.show_error()</span></code></a>.</p>

 <dd><p>Save the current values of all settings.</p>
 <p>Ensure that all keyword arguments are passed with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_save_default_arguments" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_save_default_arguments"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">set_save_default_arguments()</span></code></a>.

 <li><p>call <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">save()</span></code></a></p></li>
 </ul>
 </dd></dl>

 <p>Messages which occur before this method is called are stored and forwarded as soon as the callback is registered.</p>

 <dd><p>Bases: <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/abc.html#abc.ABC" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ABC</span></code></a></p>
 <p>An abstract base class for commands which can be used in a config file.</p>
 <p>Subclasses must implement the <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.run" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.run"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">run()</span></code></a> method which is called when <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></code></a> is loading a file.
 Subclasses should contain a doc string so that <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_help" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_help"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">get_help()</span></code></a> can provide a description to the user.
 Subclasses may set the <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.name" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.name"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.aliases" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.aliases"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">aliases</span></code></a> attributes to change the output of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_name" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_name"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">get_name()</span></code></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_names" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_names"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">get_names()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>All subclasses are remembered and can be retrieved with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_command_types" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_command_types"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">get_command_types()</span></code></a>.
 They are instantiated in the constructor of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></code></a>.</p>

 <li><p><span class="target" id="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.argument_pos"></span><strong>argument_pos</strong><a class="paramlink headerlink reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.argument_pos"></a>  The index of the argument which shall be completed. Please note that this can be one bigger than <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.cmd" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cmd</span></code></a> is long if the line ends on a space and the cursor is behind that space. In that case <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.in_between" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">in_between</span></code></a> is true.</p></li>
 <li><p><span class="target" id="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.cursor_pos"></span><strong>cursor_pos</strong><a class="paramlink headerlink reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.cursor_pos"></a>  The index inside of the argument where the cursor is located. This is undefined and should be ignored if <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.in_between" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">in_between</span></code></a> is true.  <p>This is generated by creating a formatter with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.create_formatter" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.create_formatter"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">create_formatter()</span></code></a>,
 adding the help to it with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.add_help_to" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.add_help_to"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">add_help_to()</span></code></a> and
 stripping trailing new line characters from the result of <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.utils.html#confattr.utils.HelpFormatterWrapper.format_help" title="confattr.utils.HelpFormatterWrapper.format_help"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">HelpFormatterWrapper.format_help()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>Most likely you dont want to override this method but <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.add_help_to" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.add_help_to"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">add_help_to()</span></code></a> instead.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dl class="py method">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save">
-<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">save</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">writer</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter"><span class="pre">FormattedWriter</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">Unpack</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.SaveKwargs" title="confattr.configfile.SaveKwargs"><span class="pre">SaveKwargs</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="Permalink to this definition"></a></dt>
+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">save</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">writer</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter"><span class="pre">FormattedWriter</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">Unpack</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.SaveKwargs" title="confattr.configfile.SaveKwargs"><span class="pre">SaveKwargs</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p>Implement this method if you want calls to this command to be written by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.save()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>If you implement this method write a section heading with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_heading" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_heading"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">writer.write_heading('Heading')</span></code></a> if <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">should_write_heading</span></code></a> is true.
 If this command writes several sections then write a heading for every section regardless of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">should_write_heading</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>Write as many calls to this command as necessary to the config file in order to create the current state with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_command" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_command"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">writer.write_command('...')</span></code></a>.
 Write comments or help with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_lines" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_lines"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">writer.write_lines('...')</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>There is the <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.config_file" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.config_file"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">config_file</span></code></a> attribute (which was passed to the constructor) which you can use to:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
@@ -1430,39 +1432,39 @@
 </ul>
 <p>You probably dont need the comment character <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.COMMENT" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.COMMENT"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.COMMENT</span></code></a> because <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save.params.writer" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">writer</span></code></a> automatically comments out everything except for <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_command" title="confattr.configfile.FormattedWriter.write_command"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">FormattedWriter.write_command()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>The default implementation does nothing.</p>
 </dd></dl>
 
 <dl class="py attribute">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading">
-<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">should_write_heading</span></span><em class="property"><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></em><em class="property"><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="pre">False</span></em><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading" title="Permalink to this definition"></a></dt>
+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">should_write_heading</span></span><em class="property"><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></em><em class="property"><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="pre">False</span></em><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.should_write_heading" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p>If a config file contains only a single section it makes no sense to write a heading for it. This attribute is set by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save_to_writer" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save_to_writer"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.save_to_writer()</span></code></a> if there are several commands which implement the <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">save()</span></code></a> method. If you implement <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">save()</span></code></a> and this attribute is set then <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">save()</span></code></a> should write a section header. If <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">save()</span></code></a> writes several sections it should always write the headings regardless of this attribute.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dd><p>Bases: <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#object" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">object</span></code></a></p>
 <p>A message which should be displayed to the user.
 This is passed to the callback of the user interface which has been registered with <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_ui_callback" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_ui_callback"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.set_ui_callback()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <p>If you want full control how to display messages to the user you can access the attributes directly.
 Otherwise you can simply convert this object to a str, e.g. with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str(msg)</span></code>.
 I recommend to use different colors for different values of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Message.notification_level" title="confattr.configfile.Message.notification_level"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">notification_level</span></code></a>.</p>

 <dd><p>The value of <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Message.file_name" title="confattr.configfile.Message.file_name"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">file_name</span></code></a> while loading environment variables.</p>

 <dd><p>The name of the config file which has caused this message.
 If this equals <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Message.ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES" title="confattr.configfile.Message.ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES"><code class="xref py py-const docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES</span></code></a> it is not a file but the message has occurred while reading the environment variables.

 <p>In the second form set takes two arguments, the key and the value. Optionally a single equals character may be added in between as third argument.

 <p>You can use the value of another setting with %other.key% or an environment variable with ${ENV_VAR}.

 <li><p><span class="target" id="confattr.configfile.Set.get_completions.params.argument_pos"></span><strong>argument_pos</strong><a class="paramlink headerlink reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Set.get_completions.params.argument_pos"></a>  The index of the argument which shall be completed. In that case <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions.params.in_between" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand.get_completions"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">in_between</span></code></a> is true.</p></li>
 <li><p><span class="target" id="confattr.configfile.Set.get_completions.params.cursor_pos"></span><strong>cursor_pos</strong><a class="paramlink headerlink reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Set.get_completions.params.cursor_pos"></a>  The index inside of the argument where the cursor is located.  <dd><p><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Set.is_vim_style.params.cmd" title="confattr.configfile.Set.is_vim_style"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cmd</span></code></a> has one of two possible styles:
 - vim inspired: set takes an arbitrary number of arguments, each argument sets one setting. Is handled by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Set.set_multiple" title="confattr.configfile.Set.set_multiple"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">set_multiple()</span></code></a>.
 - ranger inspired: set takes two arguments, the key and the value. Optionally a single equals character may be added in between as third argument. Is handled by <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.configfile.Set.set_with_spaces" title="confattr.configfile.Set.set_with_spaces"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">set_with_spaces()</span></code></a>.</p>
 <dl class="field-list simple">
 <dt class="field-odd">Returns<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
 <dd class="field-odd"><p>true if cmd has a vim inspired style, false if cmd has a ranger inspired style</p>
 </dd>
 </dl>
 </dd></dl>

+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expand_value</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">config_file</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">values</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">Collection</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">T</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.formatters.AbstractCollection.expand_value" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.formatters.AbstractCollection.expand_value.params.format_spec" title="confattr.formatters.AbstractCollection.expand_value"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></code></a> supports the following features:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
 <li><p>Filter out some values, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-foo,bar</span></code> expands to all items except for <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">foo</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bar</span></code>, it is no error if <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">foo</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bar</span></code> are not contained</p></li>
 <li><p>Get the length, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">len</span></code> expands to the number of items</p></li>
 <li><p>Get extreme values, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">min</span></code> expands to the smallest item and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">max</span></code> expands to the biggest item, raises <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#TypeError" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">TypeError</span></code></a> if the items are not comparable</p></li>
 </ul>
 <p>To any of the above you can append another format_spec after a colon to specify how to format the items/the length.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="confattr.formatters.Dict.expand_value">

+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expand_value</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">config_file</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">values</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">Mapping</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">T_key</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">,</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="pre">T_val</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.formatters.Dict.expand_value" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.formatters.Dict.expand_value.params.format_spec" title="confattr.formatters.Dict.expand_value"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></code></a> supports the following features:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
 <li><p>Get a single value, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[key1]</span></code> expands to the value corresponding to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1</span></code>, a <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#KeyError" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">KeyError</span></code></a> is raised if <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1</span></code> is not contained in the dict</p></li>
 <li><p>Get a single value or a default value, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[key1|default]</span></code> expands to the value corresponding to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1</span></code> or to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">default</span></code> if <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1</span></code> is not contained</p></li>
 <li><p>Get values with their corresponding keys, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{key1,key2}</span></code> expands to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1:val1,key2:val2</span></code>, if a key is not contained it is skipped</p></li>
 <li><p>Filter out elements, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{^key1}</span></code> expands to all <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key:val</span></code> pairs except for <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key1</span></code></p></li>
 <li><p>Get the length, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">len</span></code> expands to the number of items</p></li>
 </ul>
 <p>To any of the above you can append another format_spec after a colon to specify how to format the items/the length.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dd><p>The help for the generic data type, independent of the unit.
 This is displayed once at the top of the help or the config file (if one or more settings use this type).</p>
 <p>For example the help for an int might be:</p>
 <blockquote>
 <div><p>An integer number in python 3 syntax, as decimal (e.g. 42), hexadecimal (e.g. 0x2a), octal (e.g. 0o52) or binary (e.g. 0b101010).
 Leading zeroes are not permitted to avoid confusion with python 2s syntax for octal numbers.
 It is permissible to group digits with underscores for better readability, e.g. 1_000_000.</p>

+<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expand_value</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">config_file</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">values</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">Sequence</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">T</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">&#x2192;</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.12)"><span class="pre">str</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#confattr.formatters.List.expand_value" title="Link to this definition"></a></dt>
 <dd><p><a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.formatters.List.expand_value.params.format_spec" title="confattr.formatters.List.expand_value"><code class="xref py py-paramref docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">format_spec</span></code></a> supports all features inherited from <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.formatters.AbstractCollection.expand_value" title="confattr.formatters.AbstractCollection.expand_value"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">AbstractCollection.expand_value()</span></code></a> as well as the following:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
 <li><p>Access a single item, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[0]</span></code> expands to the first item, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[-1]</span></code> expands to the last item[1]</p></li>
 <li><p>Access several items, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[0,2,5]</span></code> expands to the items at index 0, 2 and 5, if the list is not that long an <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#IndexError" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IndexError</span></code></a> is raised</p></li>
 <li><p>Access a slice of items, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[:3]</span></code> expands to the first three items or to as many items as the list is long if the list is not that long[1]</p></li>
 <li><p>Access a slice of items with a step, e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[::-1]</span></code> expands to all items in reverse order[1]</p></li>
 </ul>
 <p>To any of the above you can append another format_spec after a colon to specify how to format the items.</p>
 <p>[1] For more information see the <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#common-sequence-operations">common slicing operations of sequences</a>.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 <dd><p>Getting the article right is not so easy, so a user can specify the correct article with a str attribute called <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">type_article</span></code>.
 Alternatively this method can be overridden.
 This also gives the possibility to omit the article.
 <a class="reference external" href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Appendix:English_articles#Indefinite_singular_articles">https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Appendix:English_articles#Indefinite_singular_articles</a></p>
 <p>This is used in <a class="reference internal" href="#confattr.formatters.Primitive.get_description" title="confattr.formatters.Primitive.get_description"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">get_description()</span></code></a>.</p>
 </dd></dl>

 This is displayed once at the top of the help or the config file (if one or more settings use this type).</p>
 <p>For example the help for an int might be:</p>
 <blockquote>
 <div><p>An integer number in python 3 syntax, as decimal (e.g. 42), hexadecimal (e.g. 0x2a), octal (e.g. 0o52) or binary (e.g. 0b101010).
 Leading zeroes are not permitted to avoid confusion with python 2s syntax for octal numbers.
 It is permissible to group digits with underscores for better readability, e.g. 1_000_000.</p>

 <p>By default it is assumed that the values are defined in ascending order <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ONE='one';</span> <span class="pre">TWO='two';</span> <span class="pre">THREE='three'</span></code>.
 If you want to define them in descending order <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">THREE='three';</span> <span class="pre">TWO='two';</span> <span class="pre">ONE='one'</span></code> you can pass <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">descending</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">True</span></code> to the subclass.
 This requires Python 3.10.0a4 or newer.
 On older versions it causes a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">TypeError:</span> <span class="pre">__prepare__()</span> <span class="pre">got</span> <span class="pre">an</span> <span class="pre">unexpected</span> <span class="pre">keyword</span> <span class="pre">argument</span> <span class="pre">'descending'</span></code>.
 This was fixed in <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/6ec0adefad60ec7cdec61c44baecf1dccc1461ab">commit 6ec0adefad</a>.</p>

   <section id="welcome-to-confattr-s-documentation">
-<h1>Welcome to confattrs documentation<a class="headerlink" href="#welcome-to-confattr-s-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading"></a></h1>
+<h1>Welcome to confattrs documentation<a class="headerlink" href="#welcome-to-confattr-s-documentation" title="Link to this heading"></a></h1>
 <p><a class="reference internal" href="confattr.html#module-confattr" title="confattr"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">confattr</span></code></a> (config attributes) is a python library which has the primary use case to read and write config files [<a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-config"><span class="std std-ref">example</span></a>]
 but it can also be used to parse the input from a command line and provide auto completion for it [<a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-auto-completion-with-prompt-toolkit"><span class="std std-ref">example for prompt_toolkit</span></a>/<a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-auto-completion-with-urwid"><span class="std std-ref">example for urwid</span></a>].
 This library has the following features:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
 <li><p>Static type checking of the code is possible with e.g. <a class="reference external" href="https://mypy-lang.org/">mypy</a>.</p></li>
 <li><p>Values are checked and if the config file contains invalid syntax, unknown keys or invalid values a useful error messages is given to the user via a callback registered with <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_ui_callback" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.set_ui_callback"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.set_ui_callback()</span></code></a>.</p></li>
 <li><p>It is possible to create a default config file with comments giving help and allowed values via <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.save"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.save()</span></code></a>. <a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-save"><span class="std std-ref">[example]</span></a></p></li>
@@ -102,18 +104,18 @@
 For example, assume a class has the attribute <code class="code highlight python docutils literal highlight-python"><span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;red&#39;</span></code>.
 Replace it with <code class="code highlight python docutils literal highlight-python"><span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Config</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;color&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;red&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">allowed_values</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;red&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;green&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;blue&#39;</span><span class="p">])</span></code> and call <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.load" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.load"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile.load()</span></code></a> (after the attribute has been created but before its value is used).
 Then a user can create a config file in the <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.iter_config_paths" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile.iter_config_paths"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">expected</span> <span class="pre">location()</span></code></a> and can change the attribute with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">set</span> <span class="pre">color=green</span></code>.
 You dont need to change the usage of the attribute because <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a> implements the <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#implementing-descriptors">descriptor protocol</a>.</p></li>
 <li><p>It is easy to add custom commands by subclassing <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFileCommand"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFileCommand</span></code></a>. <a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-extend"><span class="std std-ref">[example]</span></a></p></li>
 <li><p>It is well documented.</p></li>
 <li><p>Includes an example for test automation. <a class="reference internal" href="intro.html#exp-pytest"><span class="std std-ref">[example]</span></a></p></li>

   <section id="introduction-and-examples">
-<h1>Introduction and examples<a class="headerlink" href="#introduction-and-examples" title="Permalink to this heading"></a></h1>
+<h1>Introduction and examples<a class="headerlink" href="#introduction-and-examples" title="Link to this heading"></a></h1>
 <section id="config-and-configfile">
-<span id="exp-save"></span><span id="exp-config"></span><h2>Config and ConfigFile<a class="headerlink" href="#config-and-configfile" title="Permalink to this heading"></a></h2>
+<span id="exp-save"></span><span id="exp-config"></span><h2>Config and ConfigFile<a class="headerlink" href="#config-and-configfile" title="Link to this heading"></a></h2>
 <p><a class="reference internal" href="confattr.html#module-confattr" title="confattr"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">confattr</span></code></a> (config attributes) is a python library to make applications configurable.
 This library defines the <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a> class to create attributes which can be changed in a config file.
 It uses the <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#implementing-descriptors">descriptor protocol</a> to return its value when used as an instance attribute.</p>
 <div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">confattr</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Config</span>
 
 <span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">Car</span><span class="p">:</span>
 
@@ -214,15 +216,15 @@

 <span class="c1"># an int in km/h</span>
 <span class="nb">set</span> <span class="n">traffic</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">law</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">speed</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">limit</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">30</span>
 </pre></div>
 </div>
 </section>
 <section id="quickstart">
-<span id="exp-quickstart"></span><h2>Quickstart<a class="headerlink" href="#quickstart" title="Permalink to this heading"></a></h2>
+<span id="exp-quickstart"></span><h2>Quickstart<a class="headerlink" href="#quickstart" title="Link to this heading"></a></h2>
 <p>The <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.quickstart.html#module-confattr.quickstart" title="confattr.quickstart"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">quickstart</span></code></a> module defines several commonly needed <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config" title="confattr.config.Config"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config</span></code></a> instances and the <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.quickstart.html#confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager" title="confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigManager</span></code></a> class
 which instantiates two <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></code></a> instances with different notification levels as shown in <a class="reference internal" href="#exp-several-config-file-objects"><span class="std std-ref">a later example</span></a>
 and which provides a <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.quickstart.html#confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager.create_argument_parser" title="confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager.create_argument_parser"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">create_argument_parser()</span></code></a> method to create an <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html#argparse.ArgumentParser" title="(in Python v3.12)"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">argparse.ArgumentParser</span></code></a> with an improved <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.utils.html#confattr.utils.HelpFormatter" title="confattr.utils.HelpFormatter"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">HelpFormatter</span></code></a> and options to print the application version and config related options.</p>
 <p>If you are unhappy with the keys of the settings defined by <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.quickstart.html#module-confattr.quickstart" title="confattr.quickstart"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">quickstart</span></code></a> (or any third party library which uses <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.html#module-confattr" title="confattr"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">confattr</span></code></a>) you can change them by calling <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config.push_key_changer" title="confattr.config.Config.push_key_changer"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config.push_key_changer()</span></code></a> before importing the module and <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config.pop_key_changer" title="confattr.config.Config.pop_key_changer"><code class="xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Config.pop_key_changer()</span></code></a> after importing the module.
 Or by changing the <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config.key" title="confattr.config.Config.key"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key</span></code></a> attribute: <code class="code highlight python docutils literal highlight-python"><span class="n">ConfigManager</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">editor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">key</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;text-editor&quot;</span></code>.
 Changing the <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.config.html#confattr.config.Config.key" title="confattr.config.Config.key"><code class="xref py py-attr docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">key</span></code></a> attribute is only possible before any <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.configfile.html#confattr.configfile.ConfigFile" title="confattr.configfile.ConfigFile"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigFile</span></code></a> or <a class="reference internal" href="confattr.quickstart.html#confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager" title="confattr.quickstart.ConfigManager"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ConfigManager</span></code></a> objects have been instantiated.</p>
 <p>For consistency with the predefined settings I recommend to start the help of settings with an upper case letter and end it on a full stop.</p>
